channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Rising prices upset shoppers. Do retailers dare tell the truth about who’s to blame?
item.description: What people are told about tariff-triggered price hikes influences how they react.

item.title: Fed officials struggle to explain slowing economy, adding to the sense a rate cut is coming
item.description: “I don’t see a recession in my forecast at all, but I do see slower growth through the year,” said Fed governor Christopher Waller, in an interview on...

item.title: After my father died, my stepsister transferred assets into her name. Do I have any legal recourse?
item.description: “Since my dad died, I’ve been able to get just one box of personal mementos and some family possessions.”

item.title: American Eagle says Sydney Sweeney and Travis Kelce campaigns helping fall demand, as shares soar

item.title: Figma’s revenue jumps 41%, but that’s not enough to lift the stock
item.description: Figma’s stock dropped more than 12% after hours after the company merely met Wall Street’s expectations for second-quarter revenue.

item.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

item.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.
